entry.title: An Ode to Gongura Season in Hyderabad
entry.summary: Gongura leaves are abundant this month! Take a peek into our terrace where jars rest under warm October sunshine, and learn how our team balances tang, spice, and garlic for the perfect pickle.
entry.content:
Harvest season is a celebration at the Maavoori kitchen. We source sorrel leaves from trusted farms near Guntur and bring them straight to our washing bay. After a careful pat-dry, the leaves are stone-ground with sun-cured chillies and cold pressed gingelly oil.

Curious how to store your jar? Scroll down for tips, and don’t forget to try our family recipe for gongura pachi pulusu.

entry.title: Weekend Brunch Idea: Prawns Pickle Uttapam
entry.summary: Swap classic toppings for our Maavoori prawns pickle and treat your weekend guests to mini uttapams with a coastal twist.
entry.content: Fry bite-sized uttapams, crisp them on a cast iron pan, and finish with a spoon of prawns pickle. The gingelly oil and curry leaves turn this into a brunch hero. We’ve added a video tutorial and a printable recipe card.

entry.title: Inside Our Micro-Batch Process
entry.summary: Follow the four steps we take for every jar of Maavoori pickle—sourcing, stone grinding, sun curing, and sealing—to keep the legacy alive.
entry.content:
• Sourcing: Farmers send us produce at dawn.
  • Stone Grinding: Old-school rubbu rolu ensures heat doesn’t damage flavours.
  • Sun Curing: Jars rest on our terrace under morning sun.
  • Sealing: Cold pressed gingelly oil locks in the taste.

Trust, transparency, and traditional knowledge go into each batch.
